main event: A stationary, elongated and circular object with lights on the side was observed over the Columbia River on Sauvies Island, Oregon on January 9, 1956.
interesting points: The object was observed for 1 hour.
The object was described as having a silver color that then emitted a reddish glow.
The object appeared large enough to look like a hotel when the lights on the side turned on.
The weather was overcast, with a temperature of 45 degrees.
The object started moving towards the west before fading away.
result: Insufficient data for evaluation, possibly a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon.
sighted object: An elongated, circular object with lights on the side
photographs: No, the report does not include any photographs.
